body.p:
Fort Jefferson Fla
October 2d 1864
To his honor The Governor of the State of Kentucky

Believing that you have a great interest in the wellfare of every Kentucky Soldier I make bold to write you this letter trusting that you will kindly help me in this matter, as I well know that you have the power to befriend me if you see fit
I am a soldier of the 7th Kentucky Infantry and have served honestly with them since the organization of the Regiment

I was court martialed on the 24th day of April/64 charged with desertion and was sentenced to Tortugus for the period of time of the war. In the charges against me it was alleged that the offence was committed July the 10th/63 and I have been in arrest since that date and although on three different occasions I demanded a trial it was not granted me till nearly one year after the offence was committed

The facts in the case are these I was absent from my Regiment for a period of 9 days during which time I was so unwell
as to be totally unable to join the Regt and at the time was returned to the Regt in arrest was immediately sent to hospital. I believe that these facts are sufficient to fully exonerate me from the charge of desertion on which charge I have been unjustly condemned.

After being returned to the Regt from the hospitol I demanded a trial instead of a trial I was furnished with a gun and returned to duty. I was doing duty till the 22d feby/64 when I was ordered to confinement and was kept in confinement till the time of trial

Hoping that your honor will will not consider this impertinent in me and that you will do what is in your power for a native of your state and one who has always been a good citizen, and has a motherless and friendless child at home

I remain your honors
most obdt humble sent
Nasby Mills
7th Kentucky Infantry

Fort Jefferson Fla
Oct 2" 1864 --
Mills Nasby
7" Ky Infty --
To The Gov
He was sentenced by Court Martial, on charge of desertion to the Tortugas until end of War -- He was sick and unable to join the regiment -- Desires your assistance in his behalf --
